column4: how do I automatically mount a second hard drive (IDE1) in ubuntu?
you need to edit /etc/fstab
what filesystem is your second harddrive?
my second hard drive is brand new, I want to format it and use it for media storage
yes, but with what file system?
you can format it as EXT2, EXT3, FAT32, etc
I'm guessing EXT3 is the best choice...?
probably
your hard drive is probably /dev/hdb1, right?
where do you want to mount it?
I'd like to mount it on /var/media
ok then
$ sudo mkdir /var/media if it doesn't exist already
do you know how to manually mount a drive?
yes but I think I've got to format the new drive first
well, actually, you should format it as ext3 first
yeah, there's a tool in System->Administration I think
here's a good thing to do:
run this: $ sudo apt-get install gparted
it should allow you to easily manipulate partitions, I'm not sure if it allows you to add automounting lines
excellent, thanks
